node.title: Cleo Smith's case touched the nation. But not all missing children's cases will have the same outcome
node.alt: A photo of a happy smiling baby Charlie, lying on the grass and smiling at the camera.
node.description: When Cleo Smith was found, a collective sigh of relief was felt across the country. Sadly, not all who are searching for their missing children will experience the same outcome. Warning: This story contains the name and image of a deceased Indigenous person.
node.content:
["As the Smith family rejoiced in finding their beloved Cleo on Wednesday, a collective sigh of relief was felt across the country.", "Warning:\u00a0This story contains the name and image\u00a0of a deceased Indigenous person.", "Sadly, not all who are searching for their missing children will experience the same outcome.", "\"It's all come back to us this week \u2014\u00a0I've quite a bit of trauma,\" Widi Yamatji woman Kath Pinkerton said.", "First Nations kids make up a large proportion of children who go missing. Almost 20 per cent of missing children aged between 13-17 are Indigenous.", "In Western Australia in 2013, 10-month-old Indigenous baby Charlie Boy Mullaley was tortured and killed after being kidnapped by his mum's former partner.", "Charlie's aunt, Ms Pinkerton, says when the family went to police, the response was not to the same scale as\u00a0Cleo's disappearance.", "\"They looked at the mobile phone [data in Cleo's case],\" Ms Pinkerton said.", "\"If they'd done that with Charlie, they'd have known where the car was that had him, and they knew he was in the car.", "\"They disregarded everything about looking for Charlie.\"", "A 2016 investigation by the Corruption and Crime Commission found there was \"a delayed and ineffective response\" by individual officers on the night of Charlie's disappearance, but it was \"impossible to know\" whether a more rapid response could have saved baby Charlie's life.", "Now, Ms Pinkerton is asking for a meeting with WA's Police Commissioner.", "\"Just to find out why nothing did happen with Charlie \u2014\u00a0where were the resources? Why didn't they use the same protocols, realise it's a missing child and use the same urgency and the effort to find Charlie?\" she asked.", "WA Police have been contacted for comment.", "
Many missing children's reports 'not taken seriously'
", "Advocates say now is the time to speak about missing Indigenous kids.", "A 2021 report prepared by the University of New South Wales for the Australian Federal Police (AFP) revealed that 70 per cent of missing youth reports are children living in out-of-home care.", "More than a third of those cases are First Nations children.", "", "
Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts says there's a divide in how missing persons cases are treated.(AAP: Jeremy Ng)
", "Bundjalung woman and human rights activist\u00a0Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts\u00a0describes herself as a survivor of that system.", "\"For a lot of our children in care, they're subjected to residential homes, or they're going to temporary foster care homes, and they're running away because they want to come home,\" she said.", "\"Those reports aren't being taken seriously and when police intervention takes place, our young kids are more criminalised than they are provided with care or proper support.\"", "Ms Turnbull-Roberts, who is in the final year of her law degree, says while she is \"over the moon\" for the positive outcome in Cleo's case, there is an apparent divide in how police treat missing children cases.", "Noongar woman and social worker\u00a0Jacynta Krakouer\u00a0echoed this observation.", "Ms Krakouer, a research fellow at Monash University, told the ABC there was generally a different response from the public when it came to children in out-of-home care.", "\"A lot of parents can't relate to that. Particularly a lot of non-Indigenous parents who have not had their children removed. With little Cleo, we could see a lot of parents that could relate,\" she said.", "Given the high rates of missing First Nations children, Ms Krakouer believes there needs to be more transparency and accountability for state-sanctioned carers.", "\"The state is not exposed to the same level of scrutiny, certainly by the public, often because it's an opaque system and the public is simply not aware of the issues that are happening, she said.", "
Important cases 'aren't seen as newsworthy'
", "First Nations academics also say the media should face more scrutiny for the way it covers cases involving Indigenous people.", "", "
A 7News Facebook post featured photos of the wrong man.(Supplied)
", "An Aboriginal man has declared he intends to sue Channel 7 after an article wrongly identified him as the person under arrest over the disappearance of Cleo Smith.", "In a two-sentence statement published on their website, 7news apologised for their \"error\" in wrongfully publishing his images.", "The news website shared the photos on their Brisbane-based Facebook profile, which has more than 900,000 followers.", "\"This had real-life consequences \u2026 the man was distressed,\" Darumbal and South Sea Islander woman and journalist Amy McQuire said.", "\"It's lazy, but we've seen continually that there's a lack of accountability.\"", "", "
Amy McQuire says there's a lack of accountability for poor media reporting.(Supplied: Amy McQuire)
", "Ms McQuire is studying for a postgraduate degree at the University of Queensland, researching media representations of violence against Aboriginal women.", "She said there was often a lack of due diligence and cultural understanding by the mainstream media when reporting on missing and murdered Indigenous people.", "\"These are really complicated cases that aren't seen as newsworthy because the media aren't actually looking at the issues and the violence of issues like child protection,\" she said.", "\"The media is not following up cases that are important to blackfellas because they're not seen as cases that are going to grip the nation.\""]
